answers.answer: Metformin has been known to cause kidney and liver problems, but this does not happen in all patients, and there is some evidence there is a co-factor, in development of damage, such as alcoholism, or a combination of other drugs. The national database PUBMED has the studies. All in all, the drug has a relatively good safety record.  I would not fear taking Metformin if your physician recommends or concurs with your suggestion.
